tha-ap441:0.3_0: held together by the senior monks.
tha-ap441:1.1_0: “There I was a king, king of mountains,
tha-ap441:1.4_0: and he saw the world speedless.
tha-ap441:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Kuṇḍiya.
tha-ap441:11.1_0: The ninth part of mangoes and senior monks.
tha-ap441:2.2_0: to whom I gave the Teacher.
tha-ap441:2.3_0: I have accepted the great hero,
tha-ap441:2.4_0: He’s the shadow of the world.
tha-ap441:3.3_0: filling my mind with confidence in him,
tha-ap441:4.3_0: because of this sort of happiness
tha-ap441:4.4_0: having given up excellence and embraced.
tha-ap441:6.2_0: whatever fruit he enjoyed the fruit,
tha-ap441:6.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
tha-ap441:6.4_0: and the fruit of good and results.
tha-ap441:7.1_0: My defilements have been burnt away by practicing absorption—
tha-ap441:9.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
